channel.title: Can someone explain what hooks are, and what they do?
channel.description: I assume it's to extract data from the client without renaming it. I'm not sure though.

item.title: Can someone explain what hooks are, and what they do?
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

A function which accesses an internal component of a private type.

I never knew that before o.O

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone explain what hooks are, and what they do?

item.title: Can someone explain what hooks are, and what they do?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“k00dr, post:4, topic:131328”]It’s not like it really matters, but I have no idea why they decided to call them hooks, they’re actually called accessor methods…
A proper hook would capture ingame events.[/quote]

My theory is that Aryan actually had hooks and the name stuck because no one bothered to understand it.

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone explain what hooks are, and what they do?

item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

It’s not like it really matters, but I have no idea why they decided to call them hooks, they’re actually called accessor methods…

item.source: Can someone explain what hooks are, and what they do?

item.title: Can someone explain what hooks are, and what they do?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:2, topic:131328”]A hook is basically the pattern a bytecode updater uses to locate the field used. When the updater finds the field, it adds a new method to the client, something like:

public int getCurrentHP() { return ks.E; }

where ks.E represents the variable. This makes it possible for us to access this information from the bot.[/quote]

Hmm, well I wasn’t far off. Thanks.

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone explain what hooks are, and what they do?

item.title: Can someone explain what hooks are, and what they do?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

A hook is basically the pattern a bytecode updater uses to locate the field used. When the updater finds the field, it adds a new method to the client, something like:

public int getCurrentHP() { return ks.E; }

where ks.E represents the variable. This makes it possible for us to access this information from the bot.

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone explain what hooks are, and what they do?
